<<mark>excludes</mark>> <!-- We only index files which have...

...index files which have illustrations in them. -->  <<mark>exclude</mark> type="index"   match="html[not(descendant::meta[@name='Has illustration(s)'][@content='true'])]"/> <!-- We ignore the document...
...only indexing one type of document anyway. -->  <<mark>exclude</mark> type="filter"   match="meta[@name='Document type']"/> <!-- We exclude the filter...
...document anyway. -->  <exclude type="filter"   match="meta[@name='Document type']"/> <!-- We <mark>exclude</mark> the filter that specifies these documents because...
...that specifies these documents because it's pointless. -->  <<mark>exclude</mark> type="filter"   match="meta[@name='Has illustration(s)']"/> </excludes>
...documents because it's pointless. -->  <exclude type="filter"   match="meta[@name='Has illustration(s)']"/> </<mark>excludes</mark>>
...Here is an example: Here we use<mark>exclude</mark> type="index"/> to specify that all documents which...
...content="true"/>> should be ignored. Then we use two <<mark>exclude</mark> type="filter"/> tags to specify first that the...
...the boolean filter Has illustrations(s) should also be <mark>excluded</mark>.
